iso_fractal_zeros.definition: Isomorphic patterns in fractal/multifractal distributions across scales capture structural equivalences in spacing and height hierarchies of Riemann zeros—mappings where self-similarity, Hurst exponents, and multifractal spectra preserve relations invariantly. Core focus: Observed fractal-like irregularities in zero spacings mirroring chaotic or turbulent systems, with multifractal measures characterizing local clustering. Validated via statistical analysis (e.g., wavelet transforms per Odlyzko data), scale-invariant metrics, and cross-domain analogies (e.g., turbulence spectra to zero fluctuations per 2025 fractal studies). Hard-to-vary invariants like dimension spectra enable diagnostics; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox resolution (affirm self-similarity/deny uniformity/both in local-global transitions/neither in regular gaps); scores >0.97 based on 2025 fractal abstractions (minor/diagnostic utility vs. proof paths).
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from statistical geometry/web and fractal overlays (e.g., zero spacings to turbulent flows).
Validate coverage across scales; flag proof-level implications as speculative (<5% variance bound).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., multifractal spectra); integrate diachronic depth (early Odlyzko computations to 2025 wavelet analyses).
Export lean JSON; auto-export flagged implications to Module 0 for ratification.
Yoneda-like embeddings consume regenerative_pool: Map pruned fractal candidates into higher diagnostic equivalences.

properties.universality: string (e.g., Implicational: Hurst exponents indicate persistence)
